perturbation.original_text: 5.4 Party B shall be responsible for all kinds of customer inquiries and complaints arising from problems not related to Party A's network communication and platform during the cooperation. Party B shall clearly specify and make public the channel and body by which the business consulting, claims and complaints will be accepted. Party B shall be obliged to visit the online complaint handling system every day and respond to the complaints within 24 hours.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.4 Party B shall be responsible for all kinds of customer inquiries and complaints arising from problems not related to Party A's network communication and platform during the cooperation. Party B shall clearly specify and make public the channel and body by which the business consulting, claims and complaints will be accepted. Party B shall not be obliged to visit the online complaint handling system and respond to the complaints within 72 hours.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates a 24-hour response time to customer complaints, while the modified text changes the response time to 72 hours and makes the company not obliged to visit the online complaint handling system. This creates non-compliance as consumer protection laws typically require businesses to address complaints promptly, with some jurisdictions implying or specifying faster response times.

perturbation.original_text: 5.5 The Parties agree that the complaints shall be resolved within 72 hours, and Party B shall provide party A with the list of relevant persons and their respective details of contact and guarantee smooth communications 24 hours a day.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.5 The Parties agree that the complaints shall be resolved within 30 days, and Party B shall not be required to provide party A with the list of relevant persons and their respective details of contact and guarantee smooth communications during business hours.
perturbation.explanation: The original text sets a 72-hour resolution timeframe for complaints, and Party B needs to provide Party A with the list of relevant persons. The modified text extends the resolution timeframe to 30 days and Party B shall not provide Party A with the list of relevant persons. This creates non-compliance as consumer protection laws typically require businesses to address complaints promptly, with some jurisdictions implying or specifying shorter resolution times.

perturbation.original_text: 13.4 Any Party who wishes to amend or revise this Agreement must provide a 30-day prior written notice to the other Party, and the Parties shall negotiate to amend or revise this Agreement in writing.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.4 Any Party who wishes to amend or revise this Agreement must provide a 1-day prior written notice to the other Party, and the Parties shall negotiate to amend or revise this Agreement in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires a 30-day prior written notice for amendments or revisions, while the modified text reduces it to 1-day. This creates non-compliance as contract laws typically require a reasonable notice period for contract modifications, and 1-day is unlikely to be considered reasonable, potentially violating principles of good faith and fair dealing.
